info.title: NPR Identity Service
info.description: The entry point to user-specific information

externalDocs.description: Learn more at the NPR One Developer Center

post.summary: Update the following status of the logged-in user for a particular aggregation
post.description: After a successful call, this returns a User document with an updated list of affiliations.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

requestBody.description: A JSON-serialized object which contains data about a user affiliation such as the aggregation ID, affiliation rating, aggregation URL, days since last listen, and following status.

put.summary: Update the logged-in user's favorite station(s)
put.description: Right now, only the primary station can be changed. Previously selected stations will not be deleted, but the new station will be moved to first in the array.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

requestBody.description: A JSON-serialized array of station IDs

get.summary: Get the latest state information about the logged-in user
get.description: After a successful login, the client should send a `GET` call approximately once an hour to refresh the user data.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

post.summary: Copy listening data from a temporary user account to the logged-in user's account
post.description:
This can and should only be used by clients who have access to the `temporary_user` grant type.
    Third-party developers do not have access to this grant type by default, and will not need this endpoint.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

parameters.name: temp_user
parameters.description: The temporary user's ID before the user registered or logged in

content-type.description: The MIME type of the response of this link

daysSinceLastListen.description: The number of days since a user last listened to a story from this aggregation. Absent if user never listened to the aggregation.

following.description: Whether or not the user is following the aggregation. When changing affiliation status, the client is expected to toggle this value and then send the entire object back.

href.description: A link to more details about the program from the NPR Story API

id.description: A unique identifier for the aggregation (program)

notif_following.description: The topic in Firebase Cloud Messaging to which the device should subscribe if it supports notifications and the user wants notifications about the podcasts they follow.

notif_rated.description: The topic in Firebase Cloud Messaging to which the device should subscribe if it supports notifications and the user wants notifications about the podcasts they have highly rated.

rating.description: The user's average rating for this affiliation on a scale of 0-1. Absent if user never listened to the aggregation.

Affiliation.description: A program (aggregation) that a given user has shown an affiliation with

apiKey.description: A search API key for this user

Algolia.description: Parameters for querying the Algolia Search SDK for content

id.description: A short ID for this cohort; ignored on a PUT

name.description: A text string identifying the cohort, useful for metrics; ignored on a PUT

public.description: For internal use only; represents the current configuration file being used by the Listening Service

test.description: For internal use only; represents the test configuration file being used by the Listening Service

Cohort.description: An experimental grouping for User Experience A/B Testing

errors.description: A list of encountered errors, ignored on POST, PUT

href.description: A URL representation of the resource; should generally be ignored by clients unless noted otherwise

version.description: The version of the Collection.Doc+JSON spec being used

debug.description: Additional debug information if debug mode is turned on

Error.description: A serialized version of any error encountered when processing this request

ErrorDocument.description: A Collection.doc+JSON representation of an error result from an API call

attributes.description: Ignore; will be empty for errors

errors.description: A list of encountered errors, ignored on POST, PUT

items.description: Ignore; will be empty for errors

links.description: Ignore; will be empty for errors

city.description: A short description of the station's main market city

displayName.description: A short displayable text field for the end user, strictly text; ignored on PUT

id.description: Some unique identifier for the organization for the user

notif_org.description: The topic in Firebase Cloud Messaging to which the device should subscribe if it supports notifications and the user wants notifications about their localized station.

serviceId.description: Some unique identifier for the user's organization's primary service, or null if the org has no services

Organization.description: A station that a user has an affiliation with

affiliations.description: Program(s) that the user has positively interacted with

algolia.description: Use this information to search Algolia for stories

id.description: Some unique identifier for the user

totalListeningTime.description: Internal use only. User's total listening time across all platforms.

UserData.description: Object; see description of a user object below

items.description: Not used, ignored on a PUT

links.description: A list of links, not used by the Identity Service; ignored on a PUT

400WithDocument.description: A bad request; generally, one or more parameters passed in were incorrect or missing

Authorization.name: Authorization
Authorization.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

X-Advertising-ID.name: X-Advertising-ID
X-Advertising-ID.description: A device-specific advertising identifier, if possible. Apple's IDFA is an example.
